oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A ferromagnetic resonance study of La1-xCaxMnO3
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SRIVASTAVA, AK
SRIVASTAVA, CM
MAHESH, R
RAO, CNR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: magnetically ordered materials
electronic transport
electron paramagnetic resonance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ferromagnetic resonance spectra of La1-xCaxMnO3 powders (0.1 less than or equal to x 0.9) have been investigated over a range of temperatures. The spectra could be fitted to a sum of two Lorentzians for all the compositions. The intense line with a nearly constant g shows a linear decrease in linewidth with increase in temperature, while the weaker line with a variable g shows a maximum in linewidth in the T-c region. The latter is also associated with a g(eff) which depends on the composition. Copyright (C) 1996
